instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message:
on an 820-00165-02 board, I've replaced the backlight driver (new chip) and R7716 (was missing) and the display now works.  The connector and cable were completely clean of corrosion and no scorch marks.  

but on connecting everything up, I am getting visible stage lights.  

i don't have a spare screen for this model so was wondering whether there is any other diagnostic I could try to determine whether the fault is in the cable, the logic board or the screen assembly.

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message:
How this change when vary backlight level?
Another LCD assembly will help you...

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message:
yup - i know!   

The stage lights are there throughout different brightness levels.

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message: Not usual, but return lines can generate such kind of issue...

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message: Poorly soldered LED driver it sounds like...

threads.title: macbook air 2015 = stage lights
threads.message:
found a spare screen and the same thing occurs.  traces are fine so it does sound like a bad solder job.  I'll reflow and if that doesn't work put a new one on

thanks
